Click on each apparatus/reagents to know its name or click on “Continue” to start the experiment.
Take a pipette pump and pipette from the pipette stand.
Fix the pipette to the pipette pump.
Take the phage stock culture from the test tube rack.
notext
notext
Remove the cap of tube containing phage stock culture.
Heat the mouth of the tube in the blue flame of the Bunsen burner.
Take 1ml culture from the tube using the sterile pipette connected to pipette pump.
Flame the mouth of the tube again.
Recap the tube.
Keep it back on the rack.
Now, take the tryptone broth tube marked as 10[sup]-1[/sup].
Remove the cap of the tube.
Flame the mouth of the tube.
Transfer 1ml of the culture from the pipette to the tube.
Flame the mouth of the tube again.
Recap the tube.
Mix the tube properly and keep it back on the rack.
Remove the used pipette.
Fix a new sterile pipette to the pipette pump.
Now, take the tryptone broth tube marked as 10[sup]-1[/sup].
Remove the cap of the tube.
Flame the mouth of the tube.
Take 1ml culture from the tube using the pipette.
Flame the mouth of the tube again.
Recap the tube and keep it back on the rack.
Now, take the tryptone broth tube marked as 10[sup]-2[/sup].
Remove the cap of the tube.
Flame the mouth of the tube.
Transfer 1ml of the culture from the pipette to the tube.
Flame the mouth of the tube again.
Recap the tube.
Mix the tube properly and keep it back on the rack.
The same procedure is repeated for the rest of the broth tubes labeled as 10[sup]-3[/sup] through 10[sup]-10[/sup]. Each time use a new pipette.
Now, take the broth tube marked as 10[sup]-10[/sup].
Remove the cap of the tube.
Flame the mouth of the tube.
Take 1ml culture from the tube using a pipette.
Flame the mouth of the tube again.
Recap the tube and keep it back on the rack.
Discard the 1ml broth to a beaker.

Open the lid of the water bath set at 100°C.
Place the five tryptone soft agar tubes(marked as 10[sup]-5[/sup] through 10[sup]-9[/sup]) into the water bath and close the lid. Water should be at a level just above the agar in the tube.
Allow the agar in the tubes to melt for 5 minutes.
Maintain the temperature of the water bath at 45˚C till the completion of the experiments.
Now take out the soft agar tube labeled as 10[sup]-5[/sup] from the water bath.
Keep it inside LAF.
Take a sterile Pasteur pipette.
Take the E.coli culture tube.
Remove the cotton plug of the tube.
Heat the mouth of the tube in the flame.
Take a small amount of culture from the tube using the Pasteur pipette.
Flame the mouth of the tube again, recap it.
Keep it back on the rack.
Take the soft agar tube labeled as 10[sup]-5[/sup] .
Add 2-3 drops of the E.coli culture to the tube.
Keep the tube back on the rack.
Take a micropipette and adjust to 100 microlitre.
Open the tip box and fix a new fresh tip to the micropipette.
Now take the tryptone broth tube labeled as 10[sup]-5[/sup].
Remove the cap of the tube and using the micropipette take 100 microlitre of serially diluted phage stock.
Keep it back on the rack.
Take the soft agar tube marked as 10[sup]-5[/sup] containing a few drops of E.coli culture.
Remove the cap and then transfer the 100 microlitre serially diluted phage stock taken from the 10[sup]-5[/sup] tryptone broth.
Mix the tube properly.
Take the Petri plate marked as 10[sup]-5[/sup].
Open the Petri plate.
Now open the tube containing the mixture of soft agar, E.coli culture and serially diluted phage stock culture.
Pour the contents of the tube into the Petri plate.
Recap the tube.
Close the plate and gently shake it to spread agar over.
The same procedure is repeated for all the other soft agar tubes kept in water bath.
The same procedure is repeated for all the other soft agar tubes kept in water bath.
Incubate all the Petri plate cultures.
Set the time for 24 hours at 37 ˚C in an incubator.
After 24 hours, take out the plates from the incubator.
Keep the plates inside LAF and observe the results.
